q: and Kristina Bergess report: Former defense secretary Donald Rumsfeld criticized the Obama administration's response to the Egypt crisis this past Tuesday, calling it`` confusing'' and telling ABC News that the US's diplomatic effort certainly doesn't give one confidence. In a radio interview with ABC, Donald Rumsfeld was particularly critical of DNI Clapper's description of the Muslim Brotherhood as a`` largely secular'' group in House testimony yesterday that his office later had to clarify

Donald Rumsfeld takes direct aim at Colin Powell in recounting the former general's famous U.N. speech in February 2003, laying out the administration's case that Saddam Hussein indeed possessed a stockpile of banned weapons. Over time a narrative developed that Colin Powell was somehow innocently misled into making a false declaration to the Security Council and the world, Donald Rumsfeld writes. interview, Simon Cowell talked about The X Factor launch in America. With auditions set to begin on March 27th in Los Angeles, people can register online now by going to Fox.com/ thexfactor. We actually do the auditions in arenas where you have to perform in front of 4,000-5,000 people. It's a long day. You'll begin to understand why I become very grumpy, Simon Cowell told Nancy O'Dell during the ET interview that aired tonight on ABC. The X Factor auditions are open to vocal groups and solo singers, over the age of 12- and there's no upper age limit.
